title: Amazing close-up of Venus captured by NASA Parker Solar Probe
description: While on a journey to study the sun, NASA's Parker Solar Probe has captured an incredible new view of Venus.

title: FAA met to discuss more frequent engine inspections days before Denver incident
description: Only days before a dramatic engine failure on a United Airlines flight, federal regulators had met about requiring more frequent inspections of the same type of engine, a source familiar with the matter told CNN.

title: Real Madrid breaks Atalanta hearts with late goal after controversial red card
description: In a match that was largely low on quality, it was a standout moment of brilliance that eventually gave Real Madrid a narrow 1-0 win over 10-man Atalanta in the Champions League round of 16.

title: The New York Times paints a grim picture of its own workplace culture
description: The New York Times is admitting its own workplace issues, particularly around the treatment of Black and Latino employees, in a report released Wednesday. Included with the analysis is a four-point plan to improve conditions that the report's authors say will require "commitment from company leadership" as well as employees.

title: Last statue of dictator Francisco Franco removed from Spanish soil
description: The last public statue of Spain's former dictator, Francisco Franco, was removed from Spanish soil on Tuesday.

title: Fry's Electronics suddenly went out of business
description: Fry's Electronics suddenly closed all of its stores overnight, ending a nearly four-decade run in business.

title: Steve Bannon investigation gains steam as Manhattan prosecutors subpoena financial records
description: The Manhattan district attorney's office has subpoenaed financial records related to Steve Bannon's crowd-funding border-wall effort, signaling that its criminal investigation into former President Donald Trump's chief strategist is advancing, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Japan increases protection for US military amid 'severe security environment'
description: Japan's military performed 25 missions in 2020 in defense of US ships or planes, a sign of the growing integration of two of Asia's most powerful armed forces.

title: US sprinter Grant Holloway breaks the world record for the indoor 60m hurdles
description: US track and field athlete Grant Holloway just broke the world record for the indoor 60-meter hurdles.

title: Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine is safe and effective, FDA analysis finds
description: In an analysis released Wednesday, the US Food and Drug Administration said the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine has met the requirements for emergency use authorization -- another step toward the authorization of a third shot for the United States.

title: 'Top Secret' Saudi documents show Khashoggi assassins used company seized by Saudi crown prince
description: The two private jets used by a Saudi Arabian assassination squad that killed and allegedly dismembered journalist Jamal Khashoggi were owned by a company that less than a year prior had been seized by the Kingdom's powerful crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, according to recently filed court documents seen by CNN.

title: IPhone builder Foxconn is working on an electric car with Fisker
description: Foxconn, the Taiwan-based electronics manufacturing company best known for assembling the Apple iPhone, is working on an agreement with the California electric car company Fisker to develop an electric vehicle, the companies announced Wednesday.

title: Baarack got a haircut after years of wandering the Australian bushland
description: A sheep that was wandering around the Australian bushland for years has received a much-needed trim after he was rescued by an animal sanctuary.

title: Big banks will need much less office space in the future
description: Two of Britain's biggest banks have announced plans to dump expensive office space, a bet that remote work is here to stay even after the pandemic ends.

title: See mesmerizing footage as Mount Etna spews again
description: Italy's Mount Etna, one of the most active volcanoes in the world, has had spurts of activity recently, spewing fountains of lava and ash into the air.

title: Police make Europe's biggest ever cocaine bust, worth billions of euros
description: Authorities in Germany and Belgium seized more than 23,000 kilograms (50,700 pounds) of cocaine, worth billions of dollars, in an international operation that resulted in one arrest, officials said Wednesday, calling it the largest amount of cocaine ever seized in Europe.

title: Airplane seat revolution creates one of biggest beds in the sky
description: One of the largest beds in the sky is set to debut in just a few months time when JetBlue starts flying its A321neos from Boston and New York to London.

title: The hot new thing in tech: speaking into your phone
description: Before last year, 28-year-old Meredith Giuliani thought voice notes were "kind of weird," and she mostly stuck to texting. But after the pandemic hit, audio messages became a daily routine for her and many of her friends.

title: Sri Lanka Easter bombings investigation calls for former President to be prosecuted
description: An investigation into the 2019 Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka has called for the country's former President as well as senior police and intelligence officials to be prosecuted.

title: All-male boardrooms are a thing of the past at Britain's top companies
description: Women now occupy at least one seat on the board of every major British company after a 50% increase in participation rates over five years, according to a report published on Wednesday.

title: In world first, Germany convicts Syrian regime officer of crimes against humanity
description: A German court has convicted a former Syrian regime officer for crimes against humanity, in a first-ever trial of people linked to the government in Damascus.

title: What it's like to live on Italy's Covid-free islands
description: There are very few places across the globe that have managed to escape the Covid-19 pandemic; even Antarctica has reported cases.

title: How 2 teenagers discovered 4 scientifically valuable exoplanets
description: Kartik Pinglé and Jasmine Wright haven't graduated from high school yet. But they've already discovered four new exoplanets and co-authored a peer-reviewed paper.

title: Man dies after police kneel on his neck for nearly 5 minutes, family says in wrongful death claim
CNN exclusive: A solar panel in space is collecting energy that could be beamed to Earth
description: Scientists working for the Pentagon have successfully tested a solar panel the size of a pizza box in space, designed as a prototype for a future system to send electricity from space back to any point on Earth.

title: Video shows professor chastising student who is hard of hearing
description: Michael Abram, a professor at a California community college, is on paid leave and under investigation after video of him speaking critically to a hard-of-hearing student during an online class surfaced.

title: See the path Tiger Woods' car traveled during crash
description: CNN's Nick Watt visits the site of Tiger Woods' car accident to show the path the car traveled after crossing over a median and two lanes.

title: Capitol officials say riot was planned and involved white supremacists
description: CNN's Jessica Schneider reports on the FBI memo sent one day before the insurrection with an explicit warning about potential violence.
